SENT.plain: We present a case of a male patient who was admitted to the cardiology department with a diagnosis of NSTEMI (deep negative T waves in all precordial leads)
Two weeks earlier he was hospitalised because of a stroke caused by thrombosis of the left carotid artery
An ECHO showed a normal myocardial contractility of the left ventricle
The concentration of troponin I was also normal
No coronary artery stenosis was revealed in coronary angiography
We present a review of studies devoted to ECG changes in patients with stroke
